Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Necessary Code: will cause error if these are not included
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Defines the unit raw name, game uses it to identify as a unique name. (This is not displayed in-game)
The 'weight' of the unit, defines how it collides with other units, a greater value means it's tougher to push.
Circular area around the unit that makes it selectable. (mouse click/screen touch)
The unit cost from builders/buildings. Defaults to credits if no resource type is used
Reserved for future use, must be CustomUnitMetadata by default.
The max health for the unit. (will spawn with this value).
Defines the Tech Level of the unit, there're 3 levels and each will appear in a different color in the GUI.
Necessary Code: will cause error if these are not included
Common Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Comma separated list of names. Like name but lower priority, useful for multiple optional mods.
Defaults to 0. 1 = Errors if keys are duplicated. Add to "all-units.template" in root to apply to all units.
Choose whether the unit is bioligical or not, affects sound and splat (unless hideScorchMark:true)
Changes some death defaults, and sort order in Sandbox.
Normally required if this unit places buildings. Defaults to [ai]useAsBuilder.
Like price but paid for overtime while this unit is being queued or built. Construction or queue is paused if resources run out while building.
Shortcut to set streamingCost to price value and clear price, add to all-units.template to quickly switch a mod over to streaming resources.
Unit Stats Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Passive self repair rate.
The max shield hitpoints of the unit. Can start with 0 hitpoints if startShieldAtZero:true.
Unit starts with a 0 hitpoints shield on created if true.
Passive shield regen rate.
Defaults to 0. Energy that can be used as ammo for turrets, laser defense and actions.
Passive energy regen rate.
Sets the percentage of charged energy when the unit is first built.
Disables weapons using energy after reaching zero till fully recharged if true.
Regen rate while recharging.
Damage taken away from each hit. (not currently used in any vanilla units)
Min damage to keep from received damage. Defaults to 1.
Takes these resources when created and returns them when removed or destroyed.
Like borrowResourcesWhileAlive but doesn't take affect till built. Mostly useful for buildings like houses that have negative resources to add to the unit cap, etc.
Income unit creates. (custom resource version)
Disables generation_resources/credits when false. (logic_boolean)
Income unit creates. (credits only)
How often generation_resources/credits is added. Defaults to 40. (changing not recommended)
UI and Graphics Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Set to false to hide unit in Sandbox editor. (Defaults to true)
The unit name that the game shows to the player.
LANG = ISO 639-1 Code to show this text instead when game is in this language.
Unit description that the game shows to the player.
LANG = ISO 639-1 Code to show this text instead when game is in this language.
Translation file key for unit name and description.
Defaults to radius value. Set to show a larger or smaller selection circle UI on units.
Defaults to displayRadius value. Radius used when attacking/reclaiming/etc this unit
Defaults is a little bigger than radius. Set to show a larger or smaller shield circle on units.
Hide shield unless deflecting shot if true.
Defaults to 4. High value causes shield deflection to fade disappear faster.
Defaults to true. Hide units on minimap if false.
Shows a merged action list if all units selected includes one of these tags. Useful for converted units.
Useful for stealth units
Building Only Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Defines if the unit is a building.
Left, up, right, down. Tiles taken up which block unit movement. Defaults to 0,0,0,0  = 1 center tile.
Tiles taken up for placement of other buildings. Defaults to 0,0,0,0 = 1 center tile.
Left, up, right, down. Only applies to buildings, just used for GUI. Defaults to footprint.
Defaults to 0. Adds or removes padding on the drawn selection rect in UI.
Defaults to 10. Change the building position in the footprint on the X-axis.
Defaults to 10. Change the building position in the footprint on the Y-axis.
Normally used for extractors, forces building construction in a resource pool.
Rate unit builds itself when placed without a builder.
defaults to true for buildings otherwise false. Set to true to not count this unit in unit cap.
Misc Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Uses unit data from another ini file as default for this unit, supports multiple files.
Do not load unit, and don't error on missing data. Can be useful when used with copyFrom.
Overrides another unit with this unit. Build links and map positions to target unit will be replaced.
Values: emptyResourcePools_asNeutral, emptyOrOccupiedResourcePools_asNeutral, mapCenter_asNeutral, mapCenter_eachActiveTeam, spawnPoint_eachActiveTeam
Defaults to 1. Changing not recommended.
Disallow building of this unit. Can be used with overrideAndReplace to restrict units player can build.
Disallows building of this unit if nukes are disabled during match setup.
Tag unit as experimental. Affects zoomed out icon and end game stats.
Set to false to disable capture when unit is on the neutral team.
Set to true to always spawn the unit on the neutral team.
Set to true to always spawn the unit on aggressive teams on single player matches.
List of comma separated strings. Used to classify units, create special actions and balances.
Can define several variables for custom storage, unique for each unit. Allowed types: boolean, float/number, unit, string.
Example: defineUnitMemory: boolean nukeActive, boolean laserReady, float experience, unit nextTarget, unit homeBase, string customText

Description: Sets number of tiles this unit can see through the fog of war. Defaults to 15.
Fog of War range when unit/building is incomplete. Defaults to fogOfWarSightRange
Creates a soft collision effect when touching other units.
Unit cannot collide with others if true.
No unit can repair this unit if true.
If true unit cannot be selected. (includes AI players)
Defaults to isUnselectable. Can be used to create units that cannot be selected but can be targeted for attack, reclaim, etc
If true, unit is added to dropdowns for starting unit in game setup menus.
Unit will appear falling from skies when starting unit if true.
List of sound names. Only one will be played on each attack order. Only .ogg and .wav formats.
List of sound names. Only one will be played on each move order. Only .ogg and .wav formats.
List of sound names. Only one will be played on each unit selection. Only .ogg and .wav formats.
No unit can directly target this unit. If true this will also skip this unit in victory/defeat checks.
Defaults to value of canNotBeDirectlyAttacked (be careful setting this without canNotBeDirectlyAttacked, as AI will attack forever)
If true unit will not take player or AI orders.
List of tag strings, only units with these tags can directly target this unit.
Setting to true allows unit to continue living even at 0 HP, useful for custom "death" action. Warning: If not used with an autoTrigger, etc units will attack this unit forever.
When true, it lets to be captured on contact by AI as well. Defaults as false
Transport Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Defaults to 1. Number of slots this unit uses up in a transport, experimentals are often set to 5.
Number of slots this units has for transporting other units.
Only allows trasport of units that have one of these tags.
Only allows trasport of units that have one of these movement types.
Defaults to true. This unit can only transport LAND units if true.
Defaults to false. Units in this transport occupy 1 slot always if true, ignoring transportSlotsNeeded.
Makes built units stay inside transport instead of exiting it once ready if true.
Defaults to: if not self.isOverLiquid() and not self.isMoving(). This unit cannot unload units if false.
Defines if unload button should be added to the unit menu
Changes the delay it takes between each unit getting unloaded.
Defaults to true. If false transported units don't die when transport dies.
Rate to heal units that are being transported.
Defaults to true, if false this transports can hold other transports.
This unit can transport units of any team while neutral if true.
Converts this unit to transported team while neutral. Useful with whileNeutralTransportAnyTeam.
Reverts back this unit to neutral when unloaded. Useful with whileNeutralTransportAnyTeam.
Keeps transported units on their orginal team when this unit is converted if true.
Resource Node Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Used with canReclaimResources. Allows other teams to reclaim this unit. Normally used with neutral team. Use price to set what resources are gained.
When this has been reclaimed harvester unit moves on to another resource with these tags.
Defaults to unlimited. Set to restict how many units can reclaim this resource at the same time.
Like price but for resources. Useful for buildable resources.
Resource Harvester Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: If true this unit can gather resources, useful with resourceRate.
Defines the resource search range of this unit when its main gathered resource runs out.
This unit is only allowed to gather resources with these tags.
This is for reclaiming units, not for resources. See canReclaimResourcesOnlyWithTags
Multiplies the builder's reclaim speed. Different from the related key "nanoUnbuildSpeed"
Construction and Factory Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Can this can heal ally buildings (isBuilder:true is required)
Can this can heal ally units. (isBuilder:true is required), canRepairBuildings required for buildings.
Automatically try and repair damaged units in nano range. (isBuilder:true is required)
Defaults to 85. Defines the unit building/repair/reclaim range.
Defaults to 0.2. Defines the unit nano repair/reclaim speed.
Defaults to 1. Defines the unit nano building speed. (May multiply with target's buildSpeed)
How fast a builder reclaims an incomplete building (defaults to 1)
How fast a builder reclaims a normal unit (not a resource unit)
Defines if this unit must touch its target to repair it.
Defines if this unit must touch its target to reclaim it.
Defines a specific range for the repair action of this unit.
Defines a specific range for the reclaim action of this unit.
Defaults to 1. Multiplies the buildSpeed value of the created unit if this unit is a factory.
Temporarily adds extra build range to builders to build this unit. Useful for water based buildings.
Useful if adding this unit to build to existing buildings. Like canBuild but in opposite direction.
Order this build link appears in UI. Using canBuild instead is more recommended.
Build as if this is a building if true. (even if it's a unit)
If true this unit cannot be built in this build link. (can be conditioned if logicBooleans are used)
Message shown when this build link is locked.
Where created or unloaded units appears from the transport or building. Defaults to 0.
Where created or unloaded units appears from the transport or building. Defaults to 5.
Defaults to 180 for units and 0 for buildings. Defines the exit direction of created or unloaded units.
Defaults to 0. Defines the height where created or unloaded units appears.
Defaults to 70. Defines the distance that created or unloaded units moves from this unit.
Ignores parent height for exit height; useful for separating attachments with their parents for building
Death Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Deletes this unit when it starts to build if true. (target building/unit likely will need selfBuildRate set)
Kills this unit if energy level reaches zero when true.
Defines the number of scattered bit fragments when this unit dies.
Unit will spawn a nuke detonation built-in effect when dies if true.
Defines the nuke effect range when using nukeOnDeath.
Defines the nuke effect area damage when using nukeOnDeath.
Defaults to false. If true this unit will not explode with nuke when nukes are disabled in skirmish maps.
Auto-shoot a specific turret when this unit dies.
Defaults to true. Disables the unit death explode built-in effect if false.
Defaults to true. Disables the explode built-in effect on death when unit touches ground if false.
options: verysmall, small, normal, large, largeUnit, building, buildingNoShockwaveOrSmoke, verylargeBuilding
Spawns built-in or custom effects when unit dies.
Like effectOnDeath but when unit touches ground. Useful for flying units.
Spawns these units when dies. Comma separated unit identifiers.
Units spawned on death will appear on the last attacker team if true.
Disables the death scorch mark leaved when unit dies if true.
Sets a custom sound for this unit death.
If the unit was not completed, and is destroyed, play this effect. Defaults to effectOnDeath
Action Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Post automatic action cooldown (Not detection cooldown). Defaults to 1s. Warning: Setting this too low for many units might effect performance depending on the action effects.
Allows for auto action cooldown lower than 0.2s. Default to false. Not recommended.

options: everyFrame (default), every4Frames, every8Frames. Note: all triggers regardless of check rate are checked when first created and after an auto trigger cooldown. Note: Adding [core]autoTriggerCheckRate:every8Frames to all-units.template could have a large performance boost for mods with complex autoTriggers.
Faster memory update than [action_#] setUnitMemory. Useful on many applications.
Sets how often the memory is updated. Defaults at 1s. settings it to 0 will update memory every frame.
A template-friendly method of defineUnitMemory. Declare name followed by type, separated by a colon
Deprecated Keys (can be used but there are better ways)
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Deprecated in 1.13, use [action_x] sections instead
Order action appears in UI
The price of your action for the unit. (All your sub actions will be linked to the # you use)
A display text when you select your unit's action, used to explain it's purpose.
The action description.
Adds energy to unit. Has no effect unless energyMax is set
Stops unit moving while action is being applied. Useful for deploy like actions.
Use canBuild section instead.
List of unit identifiers this unit can create. Can be buildings or units. Add "setRally" to create a rally button
Order build link appears in this unit UI.
Tech level. Mostly just affects build link colour in this unit UI. Defaults to 1.
Builds target as if it was a building if true. (even if it's a unit)
Hide this build link if true in this unit UI.
Dynamically locks this build option and shows isLockedMessage if true.
Set to tell to players why a unit is locked.
LANG = ISO 639-1 Code to show this text instead when game is in this language.
Another reason for this to be locked. Just allows a different message to be shown.
Message for isLockedAlt.
Like isLockedAlt but to show one more message.
Message for isLockedAlt2.
Adds these resources to self when placing the building or producing the unit.
Overrides builded units/buildings price. Defaults to target unit prices.
Generates a blinking effect in UI if true.

Common Keys
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: File path to png image.
An optional image drawn behind other units. Useful for factories that units exit
Image to show as a custom shield
Image to use when unit dies. Can be NONE to leave no wreak
Use this to adjust the graphics of a unit if it is too far off one side
Use this to adjust the graphics of a unit if it is too far off one side
Use this to adjust the height of the graphic, especially when using decals
Fixes of by 1 pixel sizing for images with widths and/or height that has odd value
If false will hide the unit.
Only visible to player and allies when false. Recommend with showOnMinimapToEnemies. Useful for stealth units.
How pixels are used for team coloring, options: pureGreen (default), hueAdd, hueShift, disabled
False: Green pixels on unit gets converted to team color. True: Whole unit is tinted the team colour. Defaults to false
Resize image to fit this value in pixels.  Effects leg, and shadow images as well.
Resize image. Defaults to 1. Effects leg, and shadow images as well.
Land units normally default to ground or ground2 if transport.
Example: wreaks, underwater, bottom, ground, ground2, experimentals, air, top

Description: How long the transparent effect is applied to incomplete units, set to 0 to disable completely
Displays icon of the unit on Build Panel
Turrets (images can also be set on each turret)
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Default image for all turrets, can also be set per turret
Defaults false. Apply team colours on turret as well. Also effects pre-turret images
Will cause crash if image_turret is not specified, even if image is set per turret
Locks body image locked to first turret's direction
Locks legs and arms to first turret's direction
Shadow
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Image file, NONE, or AUTO. (AUTO will use image and make it transparent black only.)
If shadow image should use frame animation of main image
Locks body image shadow locked to first turret's direction

Description: Defaults to 1. Animations require this.
Calculated for you if total frames is set, but can be overridden
Defaults to image height
Default frame when not playing an animation
True to create a water wave effect when over water. Default false
True to create a dust effect when over land. Default false
True to also create effect when unit is reversing
True to also create effect when unit is reversing
Custom movement effect, can be anything
Create effect as if unit has rotated 180 when reversing
Custom movement effect, can be anything. Replaces default effect from builders
Defaults to 5
Defaults to true. Makes unit body image locked to 0 degrees when false. Often used with animation_direction_*
45 for 8 directions, 90 for 4 direction animation. Used with rotate_with_direction:false
Animation frames to offset on direction change.
Animation frames to offset on direction change. Used with frame_height.
Direction for first frame
Shows select circle/box if true
Deprecated Keys (can be used but there are better, more adaptable ways)
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: TYPE can be set to: attack, moving, idle. Use [animation] section instead for more control
End frame, must be larger then start
Scale unit image. Defaults to 1. Useful for bio units or breathing effects.
Scale unit image. Defaults to 1. Useful for bio units or breathing effects.
Delay for each frame of animation. Larger values cause slower animation
Play animation in reverse before repeating. Useful with scale_start/scale_end

Example: The attack section is for global attack characteristics, per-turret overrides these

Description: If set to false, can not attack any unit. Regards of other canAttack options below.
can also be narrowed per turret. Note: not required if canAttack is false.
can also be narrowed per turret
can also be narrowed per turret
(multiplied by globalScale)
Default true. If false unit can only attack units in contact with the water. Used for units with torpedos. (can also be set per turret)
Will only attack units that has the specified tags.
Can only attack units without the specified tags.
Allow each turrets to fire at a different target at the same time. Very useful if [turret]limitingAngle is used
Used with a low attack range (like maxAttackRange: 9) makes src and target radius get added to range, and effects AI.
Makes unit move to attack nearby units. Defaults to 250 for melee, and 0 for non melee (Works even if non-melee, but might be unexpected to players)
Are all turrets rotated when body rotates. Defaults to true
normal/bomber. bomber attack movement will retreat when energy runs out
Will die when it attacks.
Must aim body at target to shoot. Will often make the unit need to stop before it can aim and shoot.
Offset each shot multiplied by target radius. Defaults to 0.6
Example: aimOffsetSpread:0 will make unit always attack center

Description: Unit stops targeting after firing a shot. Rarely used or needed.
Unit only attacks manually ordered target. Rarely used or needed.
Will it show the range indicator. Useful for showing ranges in radar and related structures.
Defaults to 1. Can be dynamically changed with setUnitStats
Defaults to 1. Can be dynamically changed with setUnitStats
Deprecated Keys - can be used but better to set these per turret
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: (multiplied by globalScale)
Global delay, can also use delay on each turret

Example: Turrets fire projectiles with different traits

Description: Necessary Code
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: x:
y:
Positioning/Stats
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Copy all values from another turret as defaut values for this turret
Projectile fired from this turret.
Alternative projectile fired from this turret when altProjectileCondition is true
Used with altProjectile
Defaults to 0. Controls horizontal position for projectile spawn.
Defaults to size. Note: size and barrelY have the same meaning
Height of barrel in 3d. Effect projectile and shoot flame starting height
Height of the unit in 3D, to be used with decals
Controls the distance between the center of the turret and the point from where projectiles spawn.
Max turn speed of the turret
Defaults to disabled, and full turn speed is used.
Defaults to turnSpeedAcceleration. Setting this higher than turn acceleration might allow faster targets to be hit
Defaults to 0
Defaults to idleDir+180 unless attached to another turret (as attached turret will often be rotating when reversing)
Defaults true. False to disable the reseting turret angle when idle
Disabled by default. Controls how far the turret will "look" left and right
Controls the delay between idleSweep movements
Controls the speed with which the turret sweeps when idle
Disable idle sweep if false
Default 1-20 depends on idleSweepDelay, used to stop sweep syncing up with other units
Default 0
Id of another turret to attach to, will be positioned relative to it, and rotate with it.
Locks this turret's direction and shot cooldown to attached turret. Often used with warmup for multiple barrel guns
Defaults to false. Turret to use for creating buildings, etc. should only be true on one turret, and should have canShoot set to false
Required energy to fire weapon. Same as resourceUsage: energy=X
can be in credits/energy/hp/shield/ammo. Stops firing if not met
Example: resourceUsage: credits=5, energy=5, hp=100, shield=5, ammo=1

Description: Timing
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Override global shootDelay for this turret
When this other turret fires the cooldown delay on this turret will be reset/removed
Delay before firing a shot.
Rate to reduce warmup when turret is not ready to fire at any targets
Defaults to false. When true warmup is not reset after firing a shot and turret doesn't wait for warnup. Used with warmupCallDownRate and warmupShootDelayTransfer.
Defaults to 0, amount to reduces the next shot delay depending on warmup. When used with warmupNoReset, can make a each shot faster.
On Shoot
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Freezes body movement while shooting.
0 by default. Sets a barrelX offset only during odd numbered shots, useful for twin-barreled units. Use with barrelX
Targeting control
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Defaults to true
Narrows targeting for this turret, note targeting for the whole unit in [attack] is applied first. (so you can only use this to target less not more)
Default true. If false unit can only attack units in contact with the water. Used for units with torpedos.
Normally, used to optionally disable a turret based on a LogicBoolean. Eg: this unit's height
Max angle to target for turret to be allowed for fire. Defaults to 5, don't set lower. Can be set to 181 for turrets that don't need to turn to fire missiles.
Clears the turrets sub-target when using multi-targeting
Make this turret have less range than the maxAttackRange. Do not apply this to all turrets change maxAttackRange instead.
Linked with idleDir. Turret will only be able to fire at units +/- this angle.
Sets minimum range for turret.
Currently used with anti-nuke units.
Defaults to 2000, distance inflight before firing
Defaults to 0
Set to enable a projectile laser defence from this turret. Should also set the energyMax in core.
Graphics and effects
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Don't render this turret, but still can shoot, etc.
Use custom image. Overrides unit's main turret image
Used with warmup. Shows a scaling effect image on turret barrel when charging.
Can be linked to an .ogg or .wav file, or one of the default game sounds (list at bottom of reference)
Example: shoot_sound: tank_firing | shoot_sound: missile.wav | shoot_sound: ROOT:audio/shoot.ogg

Description: Current types are: small, large, smoke, shockwave, or CUSTOM: effectSectionName
Spin rate when idle, used on missile turrets
Play a custom animation from an [animation] section after firing this turret
Trigger these actions each time this turret fires
Unloads X units at turret barrel locations and gives them the attack order of turret target
Push turret forward or back after firing for a recoil effect. Value in pixels.
Time to get to offset position after firing
Time to return to default position

Example: Projectiles are necessary to inflict damage on an enemy, but can also be used for other purposes

Description: directDamage: or areaDamage:
life:
Necessary Code
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Core
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: How long till this projectile gets removed if it hasn't hit a target, 300 might be a good starting point, change depending on speed and range
Defaults to 1. Energy needed for laser defence to deflect. -1 to disable deflection (only disable for special weapons like flames)
Default to false. True to explode at end of life with all side effects and area damage instead of disappearing. Good for making area-denial weapons.
Retarget to nearby unit if target dies while in transit
The range which it will select a new target if old target has died
The lead it will try to have on the new target
Unload X units from source unit, to projectile explode location
Move unit that shot this projectile to projectile explode location
Spawn new units of this type at projectile explode location
Spawns new projectiles on end of life, useful for secondary projectiles
Projectiles to spawns when this projectile hits it's target
Spawns projectiles on creation of this projectile, useful for making true shotgun-like projectile spread
Convert units hit to the team that fired this projectile. Useful to make capturing systems
Useful for projectile interceptions (e.g. Nuke and Anti-Nuke Interaction)
Generates small flames on hit (only cosmetic)
Damage
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Damage to target unit on hit. Does not work with targetGround:true as it won't have a clear unit to target
Damages on arrival of target with an area effect, use areaRadius to adjust size of damage. targetGround needs this to damage
How wide areaDamage effects. Note this drops off (unless areaDamageNoFalloff is used)
Removes the falloff from areaDamage
Applies damage from edge of units instead of center. Mostly effects large units.
Applies area damage as an expanding blast wave rather than instantly. Useful for nuke projectiles
Defaults to false
Defaults to false
Units closer than this range aren't effected. Rarely needed. Not recommended for normal projectiles.
Defaults to 1
Defaults to 1.
Example: eg: 0 to do no damage to shields and 2 to do double damage

Description: Defaults to 1. The amount of shield to bypass
Example: eg: 0 to ignore shields and directly damage hull

Description: Defaults to 1. Can be used to create EMP weapons that affect shields only
Example: eg: 0 to ignore hull and only damage shields

Description: Amount of armour to ignore on target and do damage as if this armour was not there
Lets area effect projectiles damage own team units (can't damage allies). Useful for nuke-like weapons
Example: friendlyFire: false / friendlyFire: true / friendlyFire: only-ignoreEnemy

Description: Applies mutators to this projectile if target has corresponding tags
Same as ifUnitWithTags, but applies if target doesn't have the set tags
Changes directDamage. Defaults to 1. Be careful not to confuse players using this as the effect may not be clear. Use amour instead when possible
Same as directDamageMultiplier but for areaDamage. Defaults to 1.
Change explode effect if this mutator is active. Eg make a bounce off amour effect. Helps to make the damage change more clear to players (Doesn't work with targetGround.)
Add resource to all hit units. Warning: Be careful not be break units from other mods by adding random resources or energy to them that they don't expect.
Movement
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Target ground, and don't home in on target. Note: only areaDamage is applied if targeting ground.
Default false. for area affect AA weapons
Default 0. for shooting over or under a target. Useful for projectiles that split and rain down.
Projectile default travel speed
Accelerate to this speed
Controls the speed rampup for targetSpeed
Makes projectiles fly up into the air and come down, instead of going in a straight line
Randomly makes the shot inaccurate by this amount. Also used by weapons like the flamethrower
Randomly change the starting projectile speed by this amount
Hit target instantly
Recycles last projectile fired, only one projectile ever exists. Can turn lasers into beam weapons by using lower rate of fire and setting this to true
Make turret's aim include last projectile's spread and sweep offsets, useful for beam weapons
Default false. Keeping the list was the normal behaviour in 1.13 making area damage not apply a second time but this is not useful. Use this only if you want the old behaviour.
Defaults to false. When false projectiles are just removed. Could be true to make hit projectiles explode or split when hit
Disable the lead targeting calculations when aiming at a moving target. Defaults false.
The expected speed of this projectile for targetGround lead target calculation. Defaults to 'targetSpeed' if set otherwise 'speed'.
Sets vertical speed for projectiles with targetGround. Use gravity to make smooth arching projectiles
Controls the pull for projectiles that target ground. Use together with initialUnguidedSpeedHeight
Limits the turn speed of a projectile, making them inaccurate even with directDamage
How wide the projectile will wobble
How often the projectile will wobble
Push (or pull with a negative value) the units that get hit. Divided by target mass
Push (or pull with a negative value) the units that get hit. Ignores target mass
Move projectile as parent moves. Useful for beam effects that need to stick to source turret.
Useful for beam effects.
Add to sweep offset by factor of target's radius. 0.4 would be 40%
Useful for beam effects.
Can retarget a new target mid-flight, perfect for flak-style weapons and projectiles that collide
How long between searching for new targets. Default 5
Range which targets are reselected. Default 120
The lead of the projectile to try to hit the target. Default 15
Only retarget units with these tags
Graphics and effects
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Recolors this projectile using a hex value.
Use custom image. Overrides drawType and frame
Built-in image to use. 0:projectiles.png 1:projectiles_large.png 2:projectiles2.png
Scale image. Defaults to 1
Built-in image frame to use, starts at zero.
Default true
Use this effect if shield is active on target
Mix 0-1 of team colour into color field
default is (1-teamColorRatio). Keep more of color when mixing. Note this might saturate colors.
Reveal fog to player on explode
Shows on mini-map when fired. Some other side effects as well.
true for built-in defaults, but can also point to any custom effects
Defaults to 3
Creates a large explosion and accompanying sound on hit (only cosmetic)
Draw as lighting works best with instant:true
Draw as laser works best with instant:true
Image to use for laserEffect
Frame start of beam animationeffect
Defaults false. True to rotate with turret angle
Frame end of beam animation effect
Defaults false

Example: These are traits the unit has as far as movement goes, such as rotation and acceleration speed

Description: Defines what kind of terrain the unit will be able to move, along with other properties of unit types.
Used with large aircraft. Makes the unit fall slowly while maintaining its speed at the time of death.
Maximum movement speed of the unit.
Defines how fast units accelerate to max speed.
Don't make this too low or units will have trouble stopping at waypoints
0.6 default. Over 0.4 will reverse for short distances (at 40% speed). If set to 1 will drive in reverse same as forwards. Useful if slow turning
Should flying unit land when idle.
Defaults to 0 but if AIR movementType default is 35
Smooth animated height change. Defaults to 0 but if AIR movementType default is 1.5
Rate at which the unit changes height, either from converting or drifting
The acceleration in which a unit drops
fallingAcceleration but when destroyed
Makes the unit slide when moveDecelerationSpeed is lower, making them drift and feel natural
Allows the unit to move without fully turning in the direction its moving, useful for ships and air units
Defaults to true. Changing not recommended

Example: This determines what the AI will use the unit for, does not effect player

Description: Set to true if unit can build or repair buildings. Defaults to [core]isBuilder.
Defaults to true if unit can transport units
Defaults to true if unit can reclaim resources
Disallow AI building this unit or building
Defaults to 0.06. Set between 0-1, higher means AI is more likely to upgrade this unit before others
Buildings only
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: 0-1. AI uses 0.8 for first land factory, 0.48 for air factory, 0.47 for first turret.
Adds to buildPriority, if this unit doesn't exist in the AIs base
Adds to buildPriority, if this unit doesn't exist in the any where on the map
Defaults to 0
Defaults to 0.5. Overrides buildPriority
Create link to another unit to preserve max counts for upgraded and non-upgraded types in same base.
Useful for walls, etc
Useful for units that cannot attack back. Eg walls

Example: Legs can move around when unit moves, Arms need an animation or convert

Description: Sets position of the foot on the X axis.
Sets position of the foot on the Y axis.
Copy from another leg. Useful to only need to set leg values once
Sets the leg's attach point on the X axis.
Sets the leg's attach point on the Y axis.
Target foot/end rotation relative to body
Lock to unit body. Useful if walking unit converted to a flying unit.
Defaults to 7. Reposition leg at this distance if neighbor legs are not already repositioning.
Defaults to 16. Force reposition of leg at this distance.
Defaults to 50. Force leg to never go this far. Better to not be reached.
defaults to 1. Predicts were unit will be for leg placement based on unit speed.

Description: same as image_end
same as image_middle
Draw over body
Draw over all units
Spawns dust particles on each step.
Makes arm/leg spin, like idleSpin for turrets
calculate neighbours with X 10 times closer than Y

For performance, defaults changes based on unit size
Unused

Example: Attachments are slots where other units can be positioned or carried

Description: Defaults to false
Defaults to true. Set to false to stop this attachment attacking.
If the unit is ordered to move, it will detach. This includes waypoints from actions.
Defaults to false
Similar to shouldResetTurret:for turrets.
It will priotize targeting the main target. Defaults to true.
Will always attack the parents main target.
Defaults false. If true attached units are not converted when parent changes team. Eg from [projectile]convertHitToSourceTeam
Defaults to false. When false any queued waypoints needing movement to complete get removed.
Show all actions of the units attached in the parent unit list when selected
If parent hasn't been built, create attachment with the same built value. Links built values till attachment is complete. Useful for buildings built with nano.
Redirects damage done to this attachment to the parent instead of damaging itself directly

Example: Actions that can dynamically cause changes to units and resources

Description: Text shown as suffix, useful with textAddUnitName to create text UI
A display text when you select your unit's action, used to explain it's purpose.
none, rally, upgrade, queueUnit, building, action, infoOnly, infoOnlyNoBox, infoOnlyStockpile
Queue is shown as number of times action can be triggered based on price
Order action appears in UI
Drawn over top of icon image. Useful for upgrade icons, etc
Defaults to #64FFFFFF
Display this unit. (as if this action built this unit)
Example: eg: unitShownInUI: unitRef self.transporting(slot=0)  or  unitShownInUI: heavyTank

Description: Designates how built the unit is from a percentage of 0-100% with a number between 0 and 1.
To be used with the withTag parameter for self.queueSize(withTag=x) and queueItemAdded and queueItemCanceled events
Unit Reference - Dynamically parts from already existing units, useful w/ isAlsoViewableByEnemies
Add this unit's name to this action's text
Add this unit's description to this action's description
Add this unit's stats (eg HP, energy, resources) to this action's description
default true, Only used when unitShownInUI is a unitRef
default true, Only used when unitShownInUI is a unitRef. Replaces HP bar if active
Requirements for player/AI to use in UI
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Defaults false. When true no confirmation needed on mobile, when used with canPlayerCancel:false and allowMultipleInQueue:false will also hide the queue interface.
The price of your action for the unit. Disables action if not available. Defaults to credits if unlabelled
Example: price: credits=5, energy=5, hp=100, shield=5, ammo=1

Description: Defaults true. If false then action is disabled and shown in red in UI.
Defaults true. If false action is hidden from UI and disabled.
Defaults false. If true action is disabled, and a lock icon is shown. Mostly used for no nuke game modes
Another reason for this to be locked. Can just use OR on isLocked, but this allows a different message to be shown
When false makes it so only one action can be queued of this type (useful for keeping actions with conditions from being spammed)
When action is picked in UI, only one unit selected with get this action. Defaults to false.
Flashes in UI to draw attention to it. Might be annoying if used often, recommended only for temporarily states/messages
Allows ally players to see actions from this unit, useful for showing stats to other players (eg missile count, items collected)
Allows enemy players to see actions from this unit, useful for showing stats to other players (eg missile count, items collected)
AI - How the AI uses this action
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Use this for faction selection actions or other high priority actions such as building high priority units
Defaults false. Stop AI using this action.
Be careful with
Triggers - These skip the queue and do not use price, ignores isLocked, buildTime, etc
Example: (Use 2 actions and alsoQueueAction to automatically add an action to the queue)

Description: Parameters: created, completeAndActive, destroyed, killedAnyUnit, queuedUnitFinished, queueItemAdded(withActionTag="#"), queueItemCancelled(withActionTag="#"), teleported, touchTargetSuccess, newWaypointGivenByPlayer, teamChanged, transportingNewUnit, transportUnloadedOrRemovedUnit, tookDamage(withTag="#"), newMessage(withTag="#"), enteredTransport, leftTransport, attachmentRemoved
Example: withTag parameter for tookDamage uses tag from projectile and it is optional. withTag parameter for newMessage uses message tags.

Description: When true triggers the effects of this action instantly (ignoring price, isActive, isVisible, buildSpeed, etc)
Example: autoTrigger: if self.overWater(), autoTrigger: if self.customTimer(laterThanSeconds=5)

Description: options: everyFrame (default), every4Frames, every8Frames. This overrides autoTriggerCheckRate set on [core] Note: all triggers regardless of check rate are checked when first created and after an auto trigger cooldown. Note: Adding [core]autoTriggerCheckRate:every8Frames to all-units.template could have a large performance boost for mods with complex autoTriggers.
While action is queued
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Defaults to false. If true this action skips all other low priority actions in queue. Useful for fireTurret actions.
Stops unit moving while action is being applied. Useful for deploy like actions.
Rotate unit body to this direction when action is in active queue
If true allow rotation in 180 degrees from whenBuilding_rotateTo when this is a smaller angle
Pause action queue till rotation is finished
Convert to another unit while action is in active queue. Note: actions from the original unit will be kept
Don't change these fields when using whenBuilding_temporarilyConvertTo (both to and from), useful with setUnitStats
BETA NOTE: is broken in some cases
Effects to spawn at unit when action is first added to queue
Global sound to play to unit's player only when action is first added to queue
Misc outcomes / Results (What happens) (Note: Must be at least one outcome for an action to show)
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Skip all effects of this action if this evaluates to false
Convert your unit into another unit. properties are preserved.
Keep current and temporarily tags and ignores default tags on convertTo target.
Don't change these fields when converting, useful with setUnitStats (Allowed fields: maxHp, maxShield, shieldRegen, maxEnergy, armour, mass, shootDelayMultiplier, moveSpeed, maxAttackRange.)
Adds energy to unit. Has no effect unless energyMax is set. (Same as addResources: energy=X)
Add these resources when action finishes.
Example: addResources: credits=5, energy=-5, hp=-100, shield=5, ammo=1

Description: Same as addResources, but increased or decreased depending on AI difficulty level
Like addResources but allows logic to be used for the resource value
Sets target resources to this value instead of adding. Becareful with global resources.
Remove self with no explosions or sounds
Reset timer used with self.customTimer()

Allows changing of a select number of fields dynamically without converting. Supports =/+=/-=, with dynamic maths/logic. Changeable fields: maxHp, hp, maxShield, shield, shieldRegen, maxEnergy, energy, armour, mass, shootDelayMultiplier, shootDamageMultiplier, moveSpeed, maxTurnSpeed, maxAttackRange, fogOfWarSightRange, nanoRange, selfRegenRate
Reset changes made by setUnitStats to base values
Change this unit's memory, values can be set with logic. Memory must first be defined with defineUnitMemory
Used for unit linking without requiring unit memories or markers. It is the unit that built this by default.
Like setCustomTarget1 and with the same use. It is none by default.
Sends a message to a targeted unit
Useful for message detection in an autoTriggerOnEvent event, eg autoTriggerOnEvent:newMessage(withTag=xyz)
The data that will be sent to the targeted unit. Allows multiple key-value pairs with any dynamic data type, use eventData() to read this data in the event
Refunds the spent price in the queue of a specific action; Includes set flags in price.
Clears the queue without refunding

Description: Trigger to results of another action as well. Ignores action's requirements.
Adds another action into the normal unit's queue. Ignores action's requirements

Changes the target of the triggered action, normally defaults to the current action target. Effects things like fireTurretXAtGround, spawnUnits, thisActionTarget(), etc

Fires a turret aimed at the location of the indicated unit or marker

move, attackMove, guard, loadInto, loadUp, attack, reclaim, repair, touchTarget, build, follow, setPassiveTarget
Only for use with addWaypoint_type:build
Add to the start of the waypoint queue or the end

Sets addActionCooldownTime's target. Defaults to this action.

Don't restart animation if this animation is already playing
Finish last animation, including blend out
Stop last animation, skipping blend out
Change team to neutral. This team is allied to all other teams. Will be captured by nearby units unless [core]stayNeutral:true is used
Change to a built-in team that is aggressive to all other teams. Does not get captured.
Team id to switch to. Starts at 0. (but -1 for a neutral team, -2 for aggressive Team)

Include attachment parent or transport parent
Used with includeUnitsWithinRange, defaults to own. Can be:  own|ally|allyNotOwn|enemy|neutral|any
Defaults to true.
Just take resources from targets, don't add(or remove) to self
Don't add/remove resource from target. This clones resources. Use with takeResources_discardCollected and takeResources_triggerActionIfAnyCollected to make a resource detector.
Defaults to 1.
If less resources on target than transfer amount, only remaining resources will be transfered. Doesn't support use with some other takeResources_* keys

Description: Name of custom resource to take from
Name of custom resource to give to

Outcome - Set Resources
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Name of custom resource to set with the below 3 keys. All keys are optional, and can be used together.
Absolute value to set this resource to, ignores current value of resource. Skipped by default
Name of another custom resource to add to this on. Can be used without resourceAmount_setValue, to just add resources. Or with resourceAmount_setValue:0 to copy a resource value.
Defaults to 1. Multiple the current or new value by

Restrict attachments_* actions to these attachments
Unload all attachments. Can be used with attachments_onlyOnSlots. Same as unloading transported units

Remove tag from this unit until it is converted or reset (unless convertTo_keepCurrentTags is used)

Remove a tag from player's team.

Description: Current target or location targeted.
Example:
fireTurretXAtGround: mainGun (thisActionTarget==Marker with ground location)
alsoTriggerAction: x (thisActionTarget==Same as original action)
[turret]onShoot_triggerActions: x  (thisActionTarget==Target that was shot at)

Description: Current trigger from an autoTriggerOnEvent, otherwise null
Example:
autoTriggerOnEvent: tookDamage (eventSource==Unit that caused damage)
autoTriggerOnEvent: killedAnyUnit (eventSource==Unit that was killed)
autoTriggerOnEvent: transportingNewUnit (eventSource==Unit that was transported)
autoTriggerOnEvent: transportUnloadedOrRemovedUnit (eventSource==Unit unloaded)
autoTriggerOnEvent: queuedUnitFinished (eventSource==New unit made)
autoTriggerOnEvent: touchTargetSuccess (eventSource==Target touched)

Description: (parameters: [slot], [withTag])
(parameters: [slot])
Current target this is attacking, might not be the current waypoint target.
Last unit that attacked this.
The transporter or attachment parent. (Note: units are suspended state when transported without attachment slot)
Current active waypoint target. Includes attacking, transporting, repairing, etc.
Custom memory, defaults to the unit that created this unit.
Custom memory, defaults to null

Marker functions
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: creates a temporary marker at the position a unit is right now. Markers are very fast to create and automatically removed when no longer needed. Is not linked to any unit and still exists when the unit dies, and stays the same when source moves.
([x],[y],[height]) Returns marker with absolute offset (-y is north, +x is east)
([x],[y],[height],[dirOffset]) Returns marker with relative offset. (y+ is forwards)
Returns the event from autoTriggerOnEvent, null if used outside of a valid autoTriggerOnEvent
Global functions
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Shortcut to read the self with current defineUnitMemory types. Cannot be used on other units, use readUnitMemory for that. Don't call with self.
Returns the difference between two points
Returns the squared difference between two points. Bit faster than distance.
Returns the distance between two units or markers
Returns the squared distance between two units. Bit faster than distanceBetween
Returns true if nukes are enabled in this game's settings.
Removes decimal places from a number.
returns textA if bool is true otherwise returns textB
Returns a text string helping to explain the reason for the current result. Can see into nested logic, comparisons, and operators.
Convert a number, unit or boolean into a string
Takes a part of the string from the indicated start and end parts
Returns string length as number
Requires square root of a number
Returns the smallest number
Returns the biggest number
Displays the data from a specified message from some unit. Only use in autoTriggerOnEvent:newMessage events
Takes the sine value of a specified number
Takes the cosine value of a specified number
Produces a random number between minimum and maximum input.
Sets all letters from a string into lowercase
Sets all letters from a string into uppercase
Returns the relative angle of x1/y1 and x2/y2
Returns the relative angle of unit/marker A and unit/marker B
Returns true if unit (or marker) is with the game area; Returns false if outside bounds
Returns the width of the map
Returns the height of the map
Returns true if team is defeated and wiped out
Returns true if team is victorious
[placementRule_NAME]
Example: Allows creation of rules for requiring buildings

Description: (Only require 1 of the rules in this group pass, instead of all. Use the same group name on other placement rules to create a group.)
Search for any unit with at least one of these tags
Teams to include in search, can be: own|neutral|allyNotOwn|ally|enemy|any
defaults to 0
defaults to 0
Required
defaults to false. Might want to set to true depending on the requirement reason
defaults to false
Set min amount of units that need to be found in search. (eg needs to be near something). Defaults to 0
Set max amount of units before match fails (eg cannot be close to something). Defaults to unlimited
Defaults to true.
Highly Recommended. Message shown to player if this rule fails (will be first failing rule if using anyRuleInGroup).
defaults to true (set to false to only test unit center, true checks each tile under the unit which shows up on the placement grid. Can be easier to see requirements with true)
Prices/Resources lines - used by addResources, price, etc
Global resource
Hidden value on each unit for use by mods
use with addResources, resourceUsage or price. 0-31. Flags are stored in each unit
use with addResources, resourceUsage or price. 0-31
use with price or resourceUsage
use with price or resourceUsage
Any resource defined in [global_resource_x] or [resource_x] sections
Define a new resource shared with all units in a team, works just like the built-in credits resource. Add to 'all-units.template' (at mod root) for easy use in all of your mods
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Name of this resource in UI
Resource name on smaller UI elements like action hovertext (Defaults to displayName)
Hide this resource from the player
If 2 or mods/units define a resource with the same NAME, the displayName/displayColor with the highest priority is used
Color, can be hex with optional alpha
Don't show decimal places to the player
Adds a string before the resource value
Adds a string after the resource value
Appends another resource after this resource. It's recommended to give a "hidden" key on the appended resource to hide duplicate.
Displays the resource even when empty. Set as false by default
Sets the position of the globa resource in the screen
Shows a custom icon for the specific resource in the HUD and in text
Default as true; Shows resource icon in action description
Default as false
Hides the icon in menus referring to resource when true. Default as false
Shows color in action description
stacks another resource specified after this resource on the HUD.
Defaults as true. When set as false, allows appended resource to be hidden with the parent resource.
Displays text to show before resource value - replaces resource name and removes the colon separator
Similar to the prefix counterpart, but is displayed after the resource value
Adds a space between this and the appended resource. Defaults as false.
Sets the symbol for separating place units in: none, comma, space
Define a new resource local to unit. Works like build-in ammo resource
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Name of this resource in UI (eg hovering over unit info)
Hide this resource from the player
Used to hint to the AI that a resource node with a local resources could be used to get a different global resource. Eg when a harvester unloads the resource
Template sections can have any keys and have no effect by themselves.
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Template can get included from other files with [core]copyFrom. Eg:  [core]copyFrom: ROOT:effects/explodeEffects.template   (Note that copyFrom can include multiple files. )
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: --All these below features can be used with any section not just templates--
Example: --- Select here and press bar space ---

Description: Use in any section to include keys from a section or template. (Comma separated for multiple)
Use in any section to make [core]copyFrom not copy into it. Eg not copy an action when overriding
Define a local variable within a section (best outside of template)
Define a global variable used in all sections. Local variables have a higher priority
Define a memory for this unit, its type must be defined as well.
${X} can be used to reference variables (can also be done outside of a template). It is calculated when loading and remains static. Has no impact on runtime performance.
${section.key} can be used to reference another key (can also be done outside of a template)
%{X} can be used to add dynamic logic into some strings. (CAN NOT be used everywhere). The value will update every frame.
""" text """ can be used for multiline strings. Newlines with be removed from final result.
Sets the layer of the decal, values from lowest to highest - shadow,  beforeBody, afterBody, onTop, beforeUI.
Defaults as 0, sets a more discrete layering if 2 or more decals takes same layer type. Otherwise order in INI file will be used.
Defaults as false, displays the decal if only the owner player clicks on the unit
onlyWhenSelectedBy* will also checks parent's selection when true. Useful with attachments.
Draws the decal if a player that selects it has control (that includes shared units in multiplayer)
Draws the decal if value matches the player from the following: own, notOwn, ally, allyNotOwn,  enemy, any
Draws the decal only if the zoom level matches or exceeds it, very useful for making 3D units more optimized.
Draws the decal only if the unit is fully built
Draws the decal only if the unit is alive (If beforeUI layer default true, else default false)
Only show in sidebar, and building placement preview
Draws the decal only on the unit itself, not on the preview from building or in sidebar interface
Dynamic Value, draws the decal on a specific condition
Dynamic value,  scales the decal
Dynamic value
Dynamic value
Takes a single image for the decal - NOT TO BE CONFUSED WITH IMAGE STACK
Takes one or more image with occassional multipliers for stacking. Also useful for using image stack from a MagicaVoxel slice export
Example: Multiple image file stack: imageStack - carFloor.png, carBody.png*3, carRoof.png*2, antenna.png*10
Stack from a sprite sheet - imageStack: carModel.png*14

Description: When true, automatically reassigns team color to respective teams
Sets the height of every layer in a stack. 1 layer = 1 pixel. Can take negative values.
Useful for making 3D units, frame to offset by in imageStack. Often a value of 1 is useful in a sprite sheet.
Renders the stack in the opposite way - last frame goes on bottom, first frame goes to top
Dynamic Value, takes number of images to draw
Sets the number of frames in an image from an imageStack that uses a spritesheet.
Dynamic value, useful for animations
Add body frame number to this decal when set to 1.
Sets horizontal offset relative to the unit
Sets vertical offset relative to the unit
Dynamic value
Dynamic value
Sets the height of the whole decal
Sets the direction of the whole decal.
only affects relative offsets without rotating image
Keeps the decal on north direction regardless of the unit's direction value,  useful for custom in-uniy interfaces
Sets shadow for the decal
Attaches the decal on the specified maker. use "self" if attaching it to the unit itself
Attaches the decal to the specified leg or arm ending.
Example: basePositionFromLeg: leg_3 (this will attach the decal to leg_3)

Description: Attaches the decal to the specified turret
Draws a line from the unit to the specified marker, useful for custom waypoints
Sets the color of the drawn line
Sets the width of the drawn line
0-1, sets transparency of decal (images or line)
Comment sections can have any keys and have no effect.

Code: List of default game noises (for turret fire sound or other sound references):
Description: bug_attack, bug_die, building_explode, cannon_firing, click, click_add, click_remove, firing3, firing4, gun_fire, interface_error, large_gun_fire1, large_gun_fire2, laser_deflect, laser_deflect2, lighting_burst, message, missile_fire, missile_hit, move, nuke_explode, nuke_launch, plasma_fire, plasma_fire2, tank_firing, unit_explode, unit_explode_old, warning
